p: Teas of flowers, or with flowers mixed with other ingredients, are common in the traditional medicine of the Balkans, West Asia and East Mediterranean area under different names such as “ zhourat” (flowers) ( Carmona et al., 2005; Obón et al., 2014) or “ shai alwird” (Damask rose tea). Other rose species and cultivars ( Baser et al., 1986; Vinokur el al. 2006; Baser et al., 2013), jasmine, Hibiscus sabdariffa ( Saeed et al., 2013), chamomile ( Guzelmeric et al., 2017) and other species are also used in traditional herbal teas.
